attributes.action: extend the copyright protection for original furniture designs, from 30 years from the date of design, to 70 years after the death of the furniture designer - as is law in Germany.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently it is legal to manufacture and / or supply copies of furniture in the UK, when the original design is over 30 years old. Often misleading, the copies are often promoted in National Press, referencing the name of the designer they are copied from. 
Many factories in Eastern Europe and the Far East simply replicate the original design using lesser quality materials, often in sub standard factory conditions and with little consideration for human rights, recognised ISO standards or the environment. These cheap copies are then sent to the UK for distribution as we do not have sufficient laws against this.
Original furniture designs should be encouraged and protected for 70 years after the death of the author / designer (as in Germany and Switzerland) in order to discourage the need for immoral production facilities, plagiarism and cheap 'knock offs'. This would, in turn, promote good quality, environmentally aware manufacturers and rightfully protect the royalties earnt by designers.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "extend the copyright protection for original furniture designs, from 30 years from the date of design, to 70 years after the death of the furniture designer - as is law in Germany."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page20111
